Session.Abandon\ RedirectWithFlash "customers.asp", "You have been logged out."\ %>\ } ### FILE: includes/orders.asp {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf2867 \cocoatextscaling0\cocoaplatform0{\fonttbl\f0\fswiss\fcharset0 Helvetica;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} {\*\expandedcolortbl;;} \margl1440\margr1440\vieww11520\viewh8400\viewkind0 \pard\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7920\tx8640\pardirnatural\partightenfactor0 \f0\fs24 \cf0 <%@ Language="VBScript" %>\ \ \ <%\ Option Explicit\ \ Call EnsureInMemoryData()\ Call RequireLogin()\ \ Dim action\ action = LCase(Trim(Request("action")))\ \ Select Case action\ Case "create"\ Call HandleCreate()\ Case "update"\ Call HandleUpdate()\ End Select\ \ Sub HandleCreate()\ Dim custId, status, total\ custId = CLng(0)\ status = Trim(Request.Form("status"))\ total = CDbl(0)\ \ On Error Resume Next\ custId = CLng(Request.Form("customerId"))\ total = CDbl(Request.Form("total"))\ On Error GoTo 0\ \ If custId <= 0 Or status = "" Or total <= 0 Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "All fields are required, total must be > 0."\ End If\ \ Dim orders, nextId\ Set orders = Application("Orders")\ \ Application.Lock\ nextId = CLng(Application("NextOrderId"))\ orders.Add nextId, Array(custId, status, total, Now())\ Application("NextOrderId") = nextId + 1\ Application.UnLock\ \ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order " & nextId & " created."\ End Sub\ \ Sub HandleUpdate()\ Dim orderId, newStatus\ orderId = CLng(0)\ On Error Resume Next\ orderId = CLng(Request.Form("orderId"))\ On Error GoTo 0\ \ newStatus = Trim(Request.Form("newStatus"))\ If orderId <= 0 Or newStatus = "" Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order ID and new status are required."\ End If\ \ Dim orders\ Set orders = Application("Orders")\ \ If Not orders.Exists(orderId) Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order not found."\ End If\ \ Dim data\ data = orders(orderId)\ \ Dim custId, total, createdAt\ custId = data(0)\ total = data(2)\ createdAt = data(3)\ \ Application.Lock\ orders(orderId) = Array(custId, newStatus, total, createdAt)\ Application.UnLock\ \ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order " & orderId & " updated."\ End Sub\ \ Call RenderHeader("Orders")\ %>\ \

IDCustomerStatusTotalCreatedUpdate status
<%=oid%><%=HtmlEncode(custName)%><%=HtmlEncode(status)%><%=FormatCurrency(total, 2)%><%=createdAt%>\

system_context_model.summary: This model represents the legacy ASP application structure and its components, focusing on session management, customer handling, and order processing.

convention_profile.summary: This profile outlines the coding conventions and practices observed in the legacy ASP codebase.

rules.rule: Variables and functions should use camelCase.
Session variables should be locked during updates.

lint_recommendations: Ensure consistent naming conventions across all scripts.
Implement proper error handling for all user inputs.
scaffold_templates: Node.js Express template for session management
Node.js Express template for customer login

health_assessment.summary: The health assessment identifies key areas for improvement in maintainability, security, and reliability of the legacy ASP codebase.

hotspots.reason: Session management without proper error handling.

risks.title: Session Hijacking
risks.description: Lack of secure session management can lead to session hijacking.

remediation_backlog.title: Migrate Session Management to Node.js
remediation_backlog.problem_statement: The current session management is vulnerable to hijacking due to lack of secure practices.
remediation_backlog.risk_if_unaddressed: Potential session hijacking and unauthorized access.
remediation_backlog.suggested_approach: Use Express.js with a secure session management library like express-session.
success_criteria: Sessions are securely managed with proper locking and encryption.

analysis_walkthrough.business_objective_summary: Modernize a legacy ASP codebase into a Node.js application while maintaining current functionality and ensuring backward compatibility.
requirements_understanding: The legacy codebase includes session management, customer login, and order management.
The modernization effort requires translating VBScript logic into JavaScript for Node.js.
Backward compatibility with existing functionality is crucial.
Deployment for local Docker testing is required.
conversion_to_technical_requirements: Use Node.js for server-side logic, replacing VBScript.
Implement Express.js for routing and middleware.
Use sessions in Node.js to manage user authentication.
Dockerize the application for consistent local testing.
clarifications_requested: Are there any specific Node.js libraries or frameworks preferred for this project?
What are the specific security checks required during QA?

output.executive_summary: This project aims to modernize a legacy ASP codebase to Node.js, ensuring functional parity and backward compatibility while enabling local Docker testing.

functional_requirements.title: Application Initialization
functional_requirements.description: Initialize application-level variables and session management in Node.js.
acceptance_criteria: Application name is set to 'Legacy Customer Orders'.
Total sessions are tracked accurately.
Session variables for user authentication are initialized.

functional_requirements.title: User Login Functionality
functional_requirements.description: Implement user login functionality with session management in Node.js.
acceptance_criteria: User can log in with a username, which is stored in the session.
Flash messages are displayed for login errors or success.
User is redirected to the 'customers' page upon successful login.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Data Display
functional_requirements.description: Display customer data in a tabular format, accessible only to logged-in users.
acceptance_criteria: Customer data is displayed in a table with ID and Name columns.
Access to customer data requires user authentication.
Unauthorized users are redirected to the login page.

functional_requirements.title: Order Creation
functional_requirements.description: Implement order creation functionality with input validation in Node.js.
acceptance_criteria: Orders can be created with valid customer ID, status, and total.
Invalid input results in an error message and no order creation.
Successful order creation redirects with a confirmation message.

functional_requirements.title: Order Update
functional_requirements.description: Implement order update functionality to change order status.
acceptance_criteria: Order status can be updated with valid order ID and new status.
Invalid order ID results in an error message.
Successful updates redirect with a confirmation message.

functional_requirements.title: Session Management
functional_requirements.description: Manage user sessions and ensure accurate session tracking.
acceptance_criteria: Sessions are created on user login and destroyed on logout.
Total active sessions are accurately tracked.
Session data is cleared upon logout.

functional_requirements.title: Flash Messaging
functional_requirements.description: Implement flash messaging for user feedback in Node.js.
acceptance_criteria: Flash messages are displayed after login, logout, and order actions.
Messages are cleared after being displayed once.
Flash messages appear in a consistent style across the application.

functional_requirements.title: Docker Deployment
functional_requirements.description: Deploy the Node.js application in a Docker container for local testing.
acceptance_criteria: Application runs successfully in a Docker container.
Dockerfile is provided with necessary configurations.
Local testing environment matches production configurations.

non_functional_requirements.title: Performance
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application responds to user actions within acceptable time limits.
acceptance_criteria: Application responds to login requests within 200ms.
Order creation and updates are processed within 200ms.
Customer data is displayed within 200ms of request.

non_functional_requirements.title: Security
non_functional_requirements.description: Implement security measures to protect user data and application integrity.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Pass all OWASP top 10 security checks.
acceptance_criteria: Application passes SQL injection tests.
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities are mitigated.
Session management is secure against hijacking.

non_functional_requirements.title: Scalability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application can scale to handle increased load.
acceptance_criteria: Application maintains performance under load testing.
Session management scales with user load.
Database queries are optimized for high concurrency.

non_functional_requirements.title: Reliability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is reliable and available.
acceptance_criteria: Application is available during business hours.
Automated tests cover 95% of code paths.
Error handling is robust and logs all exceptions.

non_functional_requirements.title: Usability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is user-friendly and accessible.
non_functional_requirements.metric: User satisfaction score > 80% in usability tests.
acceptance_criteria: User interface is intuitive and easy to navigate.
Accessibility standards are met (e.g., WCAG 2.1).
User feedback is collected and analyzed for improvements.

assumptions: Node.js will be used with Express.js for server-side logic.
Docker is available for local testing environments.
Existing data structures can be translated to Node.js equivalents.

risks.description: Potential data loss during migration from legacy to Node.js.
risks.mitigation: Implement thorough data migration testing and validation.
Conduct comprehensive security audits and penetration testing.

risks.description: Performance degradation due to inefficient Node.js code.
risks.mitigation: Optimize code and conduct performance testing.

risks.description: User dissatisfaction due to changes in UI/UX.
risks.mitigation: Involve users in usability testing and gather feedback.

out_of_scope: Integration with external systems not present in the legacy code.
Major UI redesign beyond necessary modernization.

intake.business_request_raw: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into Node.js. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy for local Docker testing.

quality_gates.name: requirements_completeness
quality_gates.message: At least one functional requirement exists.

vector_context_used.title: Idempotent financial writes
vector_context_used.snippet: Financial write endpoints should require an idempotency key, persist request hash, and return the original response for retried keys with the same payload.

vector_context_used.title: PII-safe logging
vector_context_used.snippet: Logs must avoid raw personal identifiers. Use central redaction, field allowlists, and explicit data retention windows per tenant policy.

vector_context_used.title: Audit evidence chain
vector_context_used.snippet: Every regulated requirement should map to tests and release evidence. Audit events should include actor, action, timestamp, correlation_id, and outcome.

team.name: Synthetix Modernization Team
team.description: Legacy modernization team focused on functional parity and migration safety.

1.persona: Prioritize legacy parity, interface contracts, backward compatibility, and modernization risk documentation.

2.persona: Map legacy flows to modern services while minimizing migration risk and preserving business behavior.

3.persona: Rewrite legacy logic with functional parity first, then improve modularity without changing behavior.

4.persona: Design low-risk schema/data migration scripts with rollback plans and validation checkpoints.

5.persona: Produce threat models, prioritized security controls, and release-gating recommendations.

6.persona: Run actionable checks, separate environment issues from code defects, and produce clear remediation guidance.

7.persona: Validate requirement coverage clearly for business stakeholders with traceable evidence.

8.persona: Prefer local Docker deployability, deterministic health checks, and clear run instructions.

rules.title: Variables and functions should use camelCase.
rules.statement: Variables and functions should use camelCase.

rules.title: Session variables should be locked during updates.
rules.statement: Session variables should be locked during updates.

templates.name: Node.js Express template for session management
Node.js Express template for customer login

key_themes: The health assessment identifies key areas for improvement in maintainability, security, and reliability of the legacy ASP codebase.
summary.recommendation: Prioritize P0/P1 remediation items and enforce convention gates in CI
summary.notes: Generated from SIL health assessment and remediation backlog

findings.title: Hotspot: global.asa
findings.description: Session management without proper error handling.

findings.title: Session Hijacking
findings.description: Lack of secure session management can lead to session hijacking.

backlog.title: Migrate Session Management to Node.js
backlog.business_value: Potential session hijacking and unauthorized access.
plan: js with a secure session management library like express-session
acceptance_criteria: Sessions are securely managed with proper locking and encryption.
Session-related vulnerabilities are mitigated.

analysis_walkthrough.business_objective_summary: Modernize a legacy ASP codebase into a Node.js application while maintaining current functionality and ensuring backward compatibility.
requirements_understanding: The legacy codebase includes session management, customer login, and order management.
The modernization effort requires translating VBScript logic into JavaScript for Node.js.
Backward compatibility with existing functionality is crucial.
Deployment for local Docker testing is required.
conversion_to_technical_requirements: Use Node.js for server-side logic, replacing VBScript.
Implement Express.js for routing and middleware.
Use sessions in Node.js to manage user authentication.
Dockerize the application for consistent local testing.
clarifications_requested: Are there any specific Node.js libraries or frameworks preferred for this project?
What are the specific security checks required during QA?

analyst_output.executive_summary: This project aims to modernize a legacy ASP codebase to Node.js, ensuring functional parity and backward compatibility while enabling local Docker testing.

functional_requirements.title: Application Initialization
functional_requirements.description: Initialize application-level variables and session management in Node.js.
acceptance_criteria: Application name is set to 'Legacy Customer Orders'.
Total sessions are tracked accurately.
Session variables for user authentication are initialized.

functional_requirements.title: User Login Functionality
functional_requirements.description: Implement user login functionality with session management in Node.js.
acceptance_criteria: User can log in with a username, which is stored in the session.
Flash messages are displayed for login errors or success.
User is redirected to the 'customers' page upon successful login.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Data Display
functional_requirements.description: Display customer data in a tabular format, accessible only to logged-in users.
acceptance_criteria: Customer data is displayed in a table with ID and Name columns.
Access to customer data requires user authentication.
Unauthorized users are redirected to the login page.

functional_requirements.title: Order Creation
functional_requirements.description: Implement order creation functionality with input validation in Node.js.
acceptance_criteria: Orders can be created with valid customer ID, status, and total.
Invalid input results in an error message and no order creation.
Successful order creation redirects with a confirmation message.

functional_requirements.title: Order Update
functional_requirements.description: Implement order update functionality to change order status.
acceptance_criteria: Order status can be updated with valid order ID and new status.
Invalid order ID results in an error message.
Successful updates redirect with a confirmation message.

functional_requirements.title: Session Management
functional_requirements.description: Manage user sessions and ensure accurate session tracking.
acceptance_criteria: Sessions are created on user login and destroyed on logout.
Total active sessions are accurately tracked.
Session data is cleared upon logout.

functional_requirements.title: Flash Messaging
functional_requirements.description: Implement flash messaging for user feedback in Node.js.
acceptance_criteria: Flash messages are displayed after login, logout, and order actions.
Messages are cleared after being displayed once.
Flash messages appear in a consistent style across the application.

functional_requirements.title: Docker Deployment
functional_requirements.description: Deploy the Node.js application in a Docker container for local testing.
acceptance_criteria: Application runs successfully in a Docker container.
Dockerfile is provided with necessary configurations.
Local testing environment matches production configurations.

non_functional_requirements.title: Performance
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application responds to user actions within acceptable time limits.
acceptance_criteria: Application responds to login requests within 200ms.
Order creation and updates are processed within 200ms.
Customer data is displayed within 200ms of request.

non_functional_requirements.title: Security
non_functional_requirements.description: Implement security measures to protect user data and application integrity.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Pass all OWASP top 10 security checks.
acceptance_criteria: Application passes SQL injection tests.
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities are mitigated.
Session management is secure against hijacking.

non_functional_requirements.title: Scalability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application can scale to handle increased load.
acceptance_criteria: Application maintains performance under load testing.
Session management scales with user load.
Database queries are optimized for high concurrency.

non_functional_requirements.title: Reliability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is reliable and available.
acceptance_criteria: Application is available during business hours.
Automated tests cover 95% of code paths.
Error handling is robust and logs all exceptions.

non_functional_requirements.title: Usability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is user-friendly and accessible.
non_functional_requirements.metric: User satisfaction score > 80% in usability tests.
acceptance_criteria: User interface is intuitive and easy to navigate.
Accessibility standards are met (e.g., WCAG 2.1).
User feedback is collected and analyzed for improvements.

assumptions: Node.js will be used with Express.js for server-side logic.
Docker is available for local testing environments.
Existing data structures can be translated to Node.js equivalents.

risks.description: Potential data loss during migration from legacy to Node.js.
risks.mitigation: Implement thorough data migration testing and validation.
Conduct comprehensive security audits and penetration testing.

risks.description: Performance degradation due to inefficient Node.js code.
risks.mitigation: Optimize code and conduct performance testing.

risks.description: User dissatisfaction due to changes in UI/UX.
risks.mitigation: Involve users in usability testing and gather feedback.

out_of_scope: Integration with external systems not present in the legacy code.
Major UI redesign beyond necessary modernization.

intake.business_request_raw: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into Node.js. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy for local Docker testing.
assumptions: Node.js will be used with Express.js for server-side logic.
Docker is available for local testing environments.
Existing data structures can be translated to Node.js equivalents.

Map acceptance criteria to executable test types.

scenarios.name: Successful login
gherkin: Given a user with a valid username
When the user submits the login form
Then the user is authenticated and redirected to the customers page

scenarios.name: Create a new order
gherkin: Given a logged-in user
When the user submits a valid order form
Then a new order is created and a confirmation message is shown

scenarios.name: Update order status
gherkin: Given an existing order
When the user changes the order status
Then the order status is updated and a confirmation message is shown

scenarios.name: User logout
gherkin: Given a logged-in user
When the user logs out
Then the session is terminated and the user is redirected to the login page

relationships: LegacyInput contract must map deterministically to ModernizedOutput contract

non_negotiables: Define explicit error handling and observability requirements.
Map acceptance criteria to executable test types.
